alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 8:01AM EDT until July 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following county, Hocking. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported minor flooding continuing in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Although the heavy rain has ended for now, lingering high water due to earlier excessive rainfall may be slow to recede. Additional storms later this morning into this afternoon may worsen ongoing flooding issues in the area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Starr, Laurelville, Murray City, Adelphi, Lake Logan State Park, Enterprise, Ilesboro, Gibisonville, Rockbridge, Union Furnace, South Bloomingville, Haydenville, Hideaway Hills, Buena Vista in Hocking County, Oreville and Carbon Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
